You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Customize the Storefront User Experience

You can tailor a buyer’s shopping experience on your B2B Commerce for Visualforce storefront to suit your organization's requirements. The managed package provides several options for controlling page layouts, adding widgets to pages, customizing the look and feel of your storefront, and more.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
Considerations for Storefront User Experience Customizations
Fulfill your storefront's unique requirements and ensure that you still deliver a trusted experience that's easy to maintain and upgrade. Review the following considerations for customizing the default storefront functionality, and minimize the extent that you develop, test, and support custom code.
Configure the Default Storefront Pages
B2B Commerce for Visualforce defines a set of default pages that support a buyer's experience throughout your storefront. As admin, you have some control over the layouts, widgets, and content that buyers encounter on these pages.
Modify the Column Layout of a Storefront Page
B2B Commerce for Visualforce provides a set of Visualforce templates that generate Bootstrap 3-enabled HTML markup for the body of your storefront pages. The Visualforce templates define the number and arrangement of columns for content in the body of a page. You can change the column layout of a particular page by changing the Visualforce template associated with the page.
Add Widgets to Storefront Pages with Visualforce Components
Enhance the functionality of your storefront pages by enabling and configuring widgets, such as Quick Order, Mini Cart, Search Box, and more.
Customize Storefront Headings and Text with Page Labels
Add your company’s voice and tone throughout your storefront by adjusting the text shown for headings, body copy, buttons, links, and other elements. To populate these elements, create or modify records of the CC Page Label custom object. You can localize page label values for an international storefront, and you can cache page label data for better storefront performance.
Provide Intuitive Storefront Navigation with Menus
Give your buyers easy access to all content throughout your storefront. Create menus in your storefront's navigation bar that link to particular pages, specific products or categories, or custom URLs. You can nest one or more menu items within a menu.
Author Custom Content for a Storefront Page
Provide an easy option for admins to create custom content for your storefront. When you set up content authoring, an admin can use the Salesforce rich text editor to create custom static pages: company overviews, contact information, FAQs, and so on. You can implement a publishing workflow for the custom content, and easily include the custom in your storefront's search engine optimization (SEO) and internationalization strategies.
Style Your Storefront with a Theme
A B2B Commerce for Visualforce theme packages CSS, JavaScript, and image files in a static resource that you can associate with a storefront. A theme specifies a branded look and feel across your entire storefront, including colors, fonts, company logo, and other visual identity rules. With a theme, you can supplement or override the default Bootstrap styles, or insert a custom JavaScript library. B2B Commerce for Visualforce provides some default themes that you can use as a starting point for making your own custom theme.
Extend the Default Storefront Pages
If the available configuration settings aren't sufficient for delivering your solution's buyer experience requirements, you can extend some layers of the B2B Commerce architecture. For example, you can move buttons or other controls to different locations on a page, add custom controls, or add custom pages. The specific customization that you want to achieve determines which code to extend, such as Visualforce pages or components, handlebars.js templates, and more.
Source Options for Storefront Media
Before you add an image file for a product, category, or promotion, determine how you want B2B Commerce for Visualforce to reference the source file. Choose the source option that best fits your organization's resources and use cases.
Allow Only One Country, Territory, or State in Address Picklists
You can restrict address picklists on your B2B Commerce for Visualforce storefront so that a buyer can select only one default value that you specify.

title: Customizing Storefront User Experience with Salesforce B2B Commerce
